channel.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
channel.description:
[b]Introduction[/b] [i]There are a couple of tutorials on this, and all that I've seen are long (in terms of downloading) for no reason. These days, most people I downloading the cache straight from the a RuneScape server. This is fine, but it can take up to a few hours, depending on bandwidth, and there's no need, you can get it in 10 minutes flat. So, here, I'll explain my way, which doesn't vary that much from other tutorials, but will make a hell of a lot faster.[/i]
[b]Requirements:[/b] [i]A RuneScape account.[/i] [i]270mb + of disk space. - It's a big cache, but you can delete what you don't need.[/i]
[b]Credits:[/b] [i]- Defyboy[/i] [i]- Miss. Silabsoft[/i] [i]- Benski[/i] [i]- Flappy Paps Software[/i] [i]- And of course, MrPotatoHead. [i]- Me[/i]
[b]Step 1[/b] [i]Take your RuneScape account and log into a world. I'm not sure if some of the cache is limited to members worlds, but I don't think it is. If all else fails, I frequently update my models list so you can get it there. After an update; when you log into a RuneScape world, as most of you know, the cache is downloaded to [/i]"C:\WINDOWS\.jagex_cache_32\runescape". [i]Don't worry, you don't need to touch this. After you've logged in, stick around for a few minutes. I suspect it continues to download files after you've logged in. Though I don't know.[/i]
[b]Step 2[/b] [i]Now that you've acquired the cache, you need to extract it. For this, we use a tool by Defyboy that's been around for years. You can download it here;[/i]
[url=http://grabber.download.solumstone.com]http://grabber.download.solumstone.com[/url]
[i]Next, extract the .zip and then run the SetUp.bat. You'll now be given a folder that contains CacheExport.bat. Run this file. It'll begin to extract the models. This'll take about 10 minutes. It varies from PC to PC but there will be a noticeable pause when extracting cache 7, which is saved into the 'model' folder. This is because this is the largest folder, and contains your models.[/i]
[img]http://www.solumstone.com/download/images/model_scr1.png[/img]
[b]Step 3[/b] [i]Now that you have the models, you need to put them into a usable format. For this, you need DatMaker by Flappy Paps Software. What this program will do, is import the models in their current format (.MDL) and allow you to save them (export them) in .MQO (Metasequoia Model) or .DAT. You can get that here;[/i]
[url=http://datmaker.download.solumstone.com]http://datmaker.download.solumstone.com[/url]
[img]http://www.solumstone.com/download/images/model_scr2.png[/img]
[b]Next...[/b] [i]There are lots of tutorials on editing and adding models, so I won't go into that here. But this at least has shown you how to get all the models, and quickly. If for some reason this doesn't work, check out my thread in the model section. The lastest models are posted there.
Hope this helped,
Syrillia[/i]

item.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

Renaming file extensions might work.
I use this if i have lot of files i have to change. For example i have lot of pictures saved as .bmp and i want them .png.

Batch file:

@Echo off
ren *.bmp *.png
exit

Edit: Im sorry, didn’t see the year the topic is posted.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I think they just need to be renamed?
Correct me if i’m wrong MrP.

Make a new text document, type this in it.

ren *.mdl *.dat

Save that as ‘Something.bat’.
Put that inside the model folder and press it.
Should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:19, topic:265735”]LOL, we’re all lazy to an extent. BTW, a recommendation for an update, instead of having a text box pop-up when it can’t read the format, how about having a red dot appear or something. That way, people can just hit down key and scroll all the way through uninterrupted and get the models they need.

Syrillia[/quote]

Already did, it was annoying me as well, $14.99 to remove the nag screen

Seriously, i already released a V1.37 that turns the error popup off, also allows you to manually remove the black triangles, converts 500+ to 317 (with all animation skins and pri), and auto scrolls through the files. I switched computers last week so don’t have the download link for it. Ask around.

The thing I did with my extractor is reprogram it to dump the models in folders with no more than 10k models, maybe someone can redo it for others. Again it’s now on my other comp.

serpent22 - that error is coz it can’t find the file. try copying the files to a seperate folder and change the new.dat in the data folder to point to the new folder. Use notepad to edit new.dat

Read full topic

item.description:
@Surfr wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:19, topic:265735”][quote author=landonsnow1 link=topic=350837.msg2696092#msg2696092 date=1236288580]
This is too primative, try getting this theory in a more stable condition.
[/quote]

What’re you gabbering about?

Didn’t want credits, just that you understand.
The extension .dat or .mdl don’t matter, datmaker only saves as .dat coz i’m lazy.

LOL, we’re all lazy to an extent. BTW, a recommendation for an update, instead of having a text box pop-up when it can’t read the format, how about having a red dot appear or something. That way, people can just hit down key and scroll all the way through uninterrupted and get the models they need.

Syrillia[/quote]
Great idea, this would make it a lot less frustrating lol

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Syrillia:

I’m not sure they are the same format. Take one of the models, save as .DAT, then compare the contents of the two in notepad.

Well that’s coz datmaker doesn’t export the raw data, it makes the .dat from the 3d model loaded to memory… so it’s bound to be slightly different as it never uses type 4 triangles in the 3D compression…they redundant… anyway, you know who wrote the datmaker?

.mdl and .dat are the same format - trust me.
You only get .mdl coz you didn’t make defyboys extractor write them as .dat instead of .mdl
try it.

You can also tell it to just export the models without any of the other stuff, without having to rewrite the classes, it’s all in the data file.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster

item.title: Getting the latest RuneScape cache (my way). Faster
item.dc:creator: @landonsnow1 landonsnow1
item.description:
@landonsnow1 wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:10, topic:265735”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=350837.msg2694774#msg2694774 date=1236196271]
Yeh, i am the only user.
Windows Vista automatically denies access to C:/Windows/.
For example, try deleting your shell32, or any other file in Windows, it simply won’t let you.
Although i can maybe gain access using a small batch file?
[/quote]

Open the ‘data’ folder and find new.dat. Right-click > open with > notepad. Change the location of your cache to somewhere that’s allowed. Then copy the cache to that location. That should work for you.

sigh, its better to wait longer and get better results.

Same results, LOL.[/quote]
mabey sometimes but its a little confusing.

Read full topic
